conversation.content:
- 'Id': 4afcd4e06ba14039ac9950dcd4
  'Description': The employee wants to know about the pay during their parental
    leave.
  'Attribute':
  - 'Attribute-Id': 2dce9a7370a54fef8b058ad559
    'Attribute-Description': The type of parental leave the employee is taking.
    'Attribute-Restrictions': Must be one of the following {maternal first, paternal first, parental second+}
  - 'Attribute-Id': 9b96a55c0c914acf8dbdca34ab
    'Attribute-Description': The length of time for which the employee will be on leave.
  - 'Attribute-Id': 8908f47173ea4e1d9ce19bc505
    'Attribute-Description': The percentage or amount of pay the employee will receive
      during their leave.
- 'Id': 3241b0de9df34019a233c748a5
  'Description': The employee wants to check their remaining parental leave
    balance.
  'Attribute':
  - 'Attribute-Id': 32155cfd195b43539c2450027a
    'Attribute-Description': The unique identifier of the employee checking their leave
      balance.
    'Attribute-Restriction': This should be in the form of employee ID. Do not extract names. 
  - 'Attribute-Id': 5dc834919ff541f7986465075d
    'Attribute-Description': The type of parental leave that the employee is inquiring
      about.
- 'Id': 227d0d544b7e4a6ca48ac2b325
  'Description': The employee wants to update their contact information while
    on parental leave.
  'Attribute':
  - 'Attribute-Id': 074833262e9349cbaea8d2f0f5
    'Attribute-Description': The type of contact information to be updated.
  - 'Attribute-Id': faece0d719bc414683a607d50d
    'Attribute-Description': The new contact information that will replace the old one.
    'Possible-values':
    - johndoe@newemail.com
    - +1-123-456-7890
    - 1234 Example St, City, State, Country


====================================================================================================
METADATA

Has none of the above in Schema: False
Number of Intents in Schema: 3
Topics: ['Parental Leave']

Categorize the intents embedded in the supplied utterance. Recognize the entities (aka attributes) and assign them to the appropriate slots according to the schema of intents and entities.

Output example format: 

- <intent_id1>: 

   <slot_id1>: <slot1_value> 

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

- <intent_id2>: 

   <slot_id1>: <slot1_value> 

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

Find the intents (given as IDs in schema) in the text provided and extract attributes according to the definitions in the schema. If an entity or intent does not match descriptions or requirements in the schema, do not include it in the output. If no intents match, ouput -<intent>: None. 

In the absence of a specific entity, exclude it from the outcome. Note that the values given are merely representative and not all-inclusive.

Text: "I'm having back surgery and will need to be out for 6 weeks"

conversation.rejected:

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

- <intent_id2>:

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

- <intent_id3>: 

   <slot_id1>: <slot1_value> 

   <slot_id2>: <slot2_value> 

In the example, the employee is inquiring about their leave balance and wants to know the type of parental leave they are taking. The employee ID is the unique identifier of the employee checking their leave balance. In this case, the employee is inquiring about their parental leave balance. The type of parental leave that the employee is inquiring about is parental second+.
